definition: to put effort into sth/to try really hard
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: This will be one of the main impetuses of China's economic development in the future .
sentences.chinese: 这将是今后中国经济发展的主要着力点之一。

sentences.english: Product is only applicable to white paint system to reduce the color of floating and improve adhesion.
sentences.chinese: 产品只适用于白漆体系，减少颜色上浮，提高附着力。

sentences.english: We should focus on rural radio and television coverage by the extension to the family.
sentences.chinese: 要着力推进农村广播电视由村村通向户户通延伸。

sentences.english: Attached to provide superior layer of the substrate and enhance paint adhesion.
sentences.chinese: 提供优越的附载层，提高面涂与基材的附着力。

sentences.english: We strengthened regulation and oversight of thereal estatemarket to improve the mix of market housing available.
sentences.chinese: 加强房地产市场调控和监管，着力调整住房供给结构。

sentences.english: You can move side to side, back and forth, or in circles with your middle finger.
sentences.chinese: 你可以两边着力，来来回回，或者用中指画圈。

sentences.english: The low-carbon consumption should be facilitated and stimulated by further understanding and diversified approaches.
sentences.chinese: 要提高认识，多管齐下，着力推动和促进低碳消费。

sentences.english: As your main points of weighted contact, your feet matter.
sentences.chinese: 作为你的主要着力点，脚部非常重要。

sentences.english: Recently the government has been stepping up efforts to eradicate such abuses.
sentences.chinese: 近来，中国政府正着力根除这些滥用短信的行为。

sentences.english: This more stringent strategy now seems to be coming to fruition.
sentences.chinese: 这种更加严格的政策现在看来似乎正在着力实施。

sentences.english: It’s one of the reasons why we’re working to reduce our nation’s deficit.
sentences.chinese: 我们着力降低国家的赤字，这也是其中的原因之一。

sentences.english: Xianyou County is now making every effort to build it into a port city of industry, trade and tourism.
sentences.chinese: 目前仙游县正在着力打造临港工贸旅游城市。

sentences.english: First, the heavy blows against the black bars, focus on maintenance of cultural market order.
sentences.chinese: 一是出重拳打击黑网吧，着力维护文化市场经营秩序。

sentences.english: Now we use a number of tests to target our efforts on those in high-risk groups.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们着力采用一些产前检查来观测高危产妇。

sentences.english: Daoton Brand Design Consultant establishes to this trend, focusing on Brand plan and management.
sentences.chinese: 道顿品牌顺应潮流诞生，着力于品牌规划和管理。

sentences.english: He explained the Buddhist theory of doctrine.
sentences.chinese: 又着力宣传佛理，阐述对佛教教义的解悟。

definition: to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to stick closely to (a topic or theme etc)
an overall plan taking into account all factors
